summary: Inspiring Medical Affairs leader with an established history of success and 20 yrs experience in the Oncology/Hematology/Urology therapeutic areas. Skilled in leading matrix teams, developing national medical brand strategy & tactics, collaborating with Global Medical Affairs/Development/Marketing/Commercial/HEOR and supporting new product/new indication launches. Professional experience spans a continuum of pharmaceutical events from early drug discovery to development to commercial launch and post-authorization studies coupled with expertise in clinical trial execution and a doctorate in pharmacology. Passionate business development professional that is driven to improve patient care through collaboration, values, open communication, a strategic scientific approach, and teamwork.

currentPositions.description:
* US Field Medical Excellence Lead, co-responsible (w/VP) for build out of medical affairs function as launch preparation
* Imetelstat (telomerase inhibitor) launch readiness in low risk myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) and myelofibrosis (MF) including field medical deployment, training, tools (CRM), resources, insight collection & dissemination, and key systems in collaboration with VP, Medical Affairs, Commercial Team (e.g., Access & Reimbursement, Outcomes & Evidence Generation, Commercial Directors), and cross-functional partners in HR, IT, Legal, and Clinical.
* Crafting annual US MA strategic plan; including integrated evidence plan development, leading ad boards, partnering with advocacy groups, congress coverage planning, clinical trial development, strategic imperative development, IST operations, and SOP/guidance development.
* Creation and implementation of field medical strategic and tactical plans, KPI development
currentPositions.title: Senior Director, US Medical Affairs Strategy & Field Medical Excellence

headline: Sr. Director, US MA Strategy & Field Medical Excellence

organizations.name: Association of Multicultural Scientists
organizations.description:
Tripled size of membership while promoting diversity and organizing / promoting multiple seminars on scientific writing and presentations (average 150 attendees – professors, post-docs, students, doctors).

The purpose of this association is as follows:
A.) Assist students in the successful completion of their graduate studies by offering activities and support which will meet academic, professional, and social needs in an atmosphere of cultural context and comfort.
B.) Promote awareness within the university's scientific community of the ever growing presence of qualified minorities in the scientific field.
C.) Promote awareness of other minority programs on campus through joint sponsorship of activities.
D.) Improve the general recruitment, retainment and support of underrepresented people, in both student and faculty positions in the medical school graduate programs.

organizations.name: United States Soccer Federation & National Intercollegiate Soccer Officials Association
organizations.description: Advanced to top 1% of referees by grade while developing strong problem-solving and communications skills in a high-pressure team-oriented environment while mentoring and assessing younger officials for rank and grade advancement

commentary.text: Thank you for all the interest in this position - the talent is outstanding! I am pleased to announce that this position has been filled.
